chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance in Blood-5th Offense
Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance 5th Offense

result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin W. Markham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
(Cases15CF783, 17CF121, 21CF404 are called at 10:42 AM) Defendant Martin W. Markham in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Martin W. Markham.  District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. State moves for leave to file an amended Information regarding Counts 2 and 4 in 15CF783. No objection. So ordered. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to 15CF783 Count 1- Possession of Narcotic Drugs, Count 4- Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th Offense), 17CF121 Count 2- Obstructing an Officer, 21CF404- Count 1- Felony Bail Jumping, Count 3- Obstructing an Officer. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 21TR1563. 
Court orders in 17CF121 and 21CF404- Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and Court costs. 
Court withholds sentence in 15CF783 and orders 3 years Probation with the following conditions: 180 day jail on Count 4 with Huber (if available), all but 60 days stayed pending further order of the court; $600 fine plus costs on Count 4; 3 years Driver's License revocation on Count 4; 3 years IID on Count 4; AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 180 days credit, if revoked.
Amending Count 2 to OWI 4th Offense and Count 4 to Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance 4th Offense.
